repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: If there are errors in the last line of a buffer, something like `Gdk` or `G2k3J` will produce an error (at least with `lua_ls`):
```
Error executing vim.schedule lua callback: .../neovim/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/diagnostic.lua:1446: Invalid 'line': out of range
```
Solution: Only set extmarks if the target buffer line still exists

---

I had difficulty writing a test for this, it kept passing with and without the change...

comment_data.body: This will fail if the buffer isn't loaded.
You can probably move the `api.nvim_buf_is_loaded(bufnr)` check higher up in this function.
Alright I've moved it out up top, also changing the parameter from `diagnostic.bufnr` to just the given `bufnr`. Hopefully this is fine
No need to iterate over each diagnostic if the bufnr is bad. Return early way higher up in the function. Also, the current code will still error if there's an invalid buffer.
is it intentional that this is done so late in the function? is that because the `text` and `opts` state needs to be updated even if the buffer isn't loaded?
I don't think so -- I'll move it to the beginning. The `underline.show` function does this and seems to be fine

comment_regular_data.body: Do you have a repro for this?
Do you prefer repros without `nvim-lspconfig`? If so I can make one in a second, I was still figuring that part out. If you don't mind a repro with that plugin I can make one quicker

I usually do something like this:

``` lua
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("FileType", {
        pattern = "go",
        callback = function()
	        vim.lsp.start({ cmd = { "gopls" } })
        end
})
```

But one with `nvim-lspconfig` is better than nothing.

Ok. Minimum repro:
```lua
-- Create a custom namespace. This will aggregate signs from all other
-- namespaces and only show the one with the highest severity on a
-- given line
local ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('my_namespace')
-- Get a reference to the original signs handler
local orig_signs_handler = vim.diagnostic.handlers.signs
-- Override the built-in signs handler
vim.diagnostic.handlers.signs = {
  show = function(_, bufnr, _, opts)
    -- Get all diagnostics from the whole buffer rather than just the
    -- diagnostics passed to the handler
    local diagnostics = vim.diagnostic.get(bufnr)
    -- Find the "worst" diagnostic per line
    local max_severity_per_line = {}
    for _, d in pairs(diagnostics) do
      local m = max_severity_per_line[d.lnum]
      if not m or d.severity < m.severity then
        max_severity_per_line[d.lnum] = d
      end
    end
    -- Pass the filtered diagnostics (with our custom namespace) to
    -- the original handler
    local filtered_diagnostics = vim.tbl_values(max_severity_per_line)
    orig_signs_handler.show(ns, bufnr, filtered_diagnostics, opts)
  end,
  hide = function(_, bufnr)
    orig_signs_handler.hide(ns, bufnr)
  end,
}

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd({ 'BufEnter', 'BufWinEnter' }, {
  pattern = { '*.lua' },
  callback = function()
    vim.lsp.start {
      name = 'lua_ls',
      cmd = { 'lua-language-server' },
      root_dir = vim.fs.root(0, {
        '.luarc.json',
        '.luarc.jsonc',
        '.luacheckrc',
        ' .stylua.toml',
        'stylua.toml',
        'selene.toml',
        'selene.yml',
        '.git',
      }),
    }
  end,
})
```

Looks like this error has to do with the default sign handler example. For a given `test.lua` file:

```
-- comment
-- here
err
```

If you open with `nvim --clean -u minimum_repro.lua test.lua`, then wait for the diagnostic signs to be published, doing `Gdk` gives the above error. I'll fix up the PR in just a second
Code LGTM. ~~But I'm not clear on why your signs override triggers the bug and the default one doesn't. ðŸ¤”~~

> Code LGTM. ~But I'm not clear on why your signs override triggers the bug and the default one doesn't. ðŸ¤”~

Did you ever figure out why this only happens with the override? :joy:

title: fix(diagnostics): don't apply extmarks to invalid lines
